channel.title: Cherokee Error?

item.title: Cherokee Error?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You need to instantiate the mouse class properly (like with it’s constructor) and then you can use it. Psuedo-code would be like this:

Mouse mouse = new Mouse(myApplet);
mouse.mouse(500,500,LEFT_BUTTON);

And if you don’t understand these concepts, you really shouldn’t be programming yet and should instead be learning to program.

Read full topic

item.title: Cherokee Error?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Christ.

@OP: mouse is a member of a static class. It should be thatClassName.mouse(blahblahblah). It also needs to be called from a static context. (Keep jbot() static)

Everyone else can go die in a flaming cesspit of death

Read full topic

item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“jimmy5410, post:9, topic:264878”]…
Okay… like you said, you can’t really STEAL something that’s open source. Second, I’m trying to increase my Java skills…[/quote]
By COPYING AND PASTING, still COPYRIGHTED code, not UNDERSTANDING it, and expecting it to WORK? My first post was nothing short of exactly what you needed to do.

Start with this, be sure to READ it (damn, I’m good at capitalizing words like you): http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/

item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“jimmy5410, post:13, topic:264878”]Okay… I’ll just use the Robot class in java, but can somebody explain how this is static?

[code]import java.awt.Robot;

public class Mouse {

public void mouse(int x, int y) {
	Robot.mouseMove(x,y);
}

}[/code][/quote]

go learn the basics, and then you will find out.

item.title: Cherokee Error?
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

I’m trying to put the Mouse function and stuff from Cherokee into my nooby bot, but I always get errors.

My code

[code]import com.cherokee.*;
import com.cherokee.Setup;

public class Test {
public static void jbot() {
mouse(500,500,LEFT_BUTTON);
}
}[/code]

the com/cherokee folder with everything is right there, but if I try to compile, I get

cannot fild symbol symbol : method mouse(int,int,int)

even though it’s right there in cherokee! What did I mess up on?

Read full topic
